intro: Theophrasta kalbreyeri, commonly known as the Kalbreyer's dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, silver-green leaves and produces bright yellow composite flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along coastal areas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Theophrasta kalbreyeri is known for its resilience and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
